Reviews.Title: “Not Amazed”
Reviews.Author: MsVerde
Reviews.Content: I spent one night (10 April) at this hotel to be nearby for an early morning appointment. When I arrived the exterior looked like a youyh hostel or a homeless shelter wpeople milling around outside the front door. The check in went well, the clerk was pleasant and helpful. The one way street outside was full so I had to use "valet" parking. My room was almost clean, the bed/bedding was clean but the floor was in need of vaccuming and it was not stocked with towels. The longer I stayed, the more I noticed. I found jelly beans, shredded paper and crumbs in various areas of the room. As I checked the bathroom I found hair from previous occupants in the shower. Luckily for me, I carry Lysol disinfectant cleaner in my bag. During the night I heard what sounded like garbage trucks and other noises throughout the night. Checkout was an unpleasant experience with a confused and frazzled young trainee working the front desk apparently alone. Other employees were out searching for cars that had been "valet parked", previously. At that time I was told that I should have called 30 minutes before I needed my car. As I waited I watched kitchen staff/cooks(?) come to the lobby to hang out. One look at their clothing and hair and I was so glad that I had not partaken of the "free breakfast". I do realize that this may have been a "one time" situation but I will think twice about staying at this particular location.

Reviews.Title: “Home2 Suites Baltimore - Good Deal”
Reviews.Author: JPM53
Reviews.Content: A good value. Updated and clean. Near many attractions. Breakfast could use a little more variety but still a good feature to have. Nice and friendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Comfort and nearby dining”
Reviews.Author: CTripleS
Reviews.Content: This hotel is geared to the business traveler, although the kitchen facilities in each room make it attractive for anyone not wanting to be dependent on restaurants for all meals. A basic breakfast (yoghurt, breads, cereal, juice and coffee/tea) is included in the reasonable nightly rate, and there are a variety of ethnic choices very near by when a restaurant is preferred. Wifi is included, and charging your mobile devices is easy with the outlets built into the desk lamp. The lighting is well thought out, and you can comfortably read in bed, a rarity in hotels. For those on a longer trip or staying an extended time in Baltimoe, there is a laundry room and a common room where you could have a small meeting or visit with friends. One caution- as a woman traveling alone, I was not comfortable with the neighborhood after about 7PM. The hotel appears to have good security, but walking back from the harbor area or even nearby convention hotels did not feel entirely safe. This caution is more about Baltimore than Home2 however.

Reviews.Title: “Really a Home Away From Home”
Reviews.Author: Lowtech
Reviews.Content: Home2 is a newer Hilton chain, with reasonable rates and individual ownership. Having stayed in several other all-suites hotels I found Home2 to be exceptionally warm and intimate - not a cold, corporate-feeling place at all. As a woman staying alone I am always conscious of the security and feeling of safety in hotels, and here I felt completely comfortable. The entire staff, including management, front desk, housekeeping and shuttle drivers, was friendly and supportive as I "commuted" to Johns Hopkins Hospital daily during my husband's heart surgery and post-op week. The parking situation is difficult, due to the location, but valet parking is offered and on-street paid parking is available as well. I left my car in the Hopkins garage and used the hotel's complementary shuttle each day. I was offered a discounted Hopkins rate on my room, which was delightfully un-fussy (no faux-art or foolish frills), with a very nice galley kitchen, king bed, free wired or WiFi Internet connection, and excellent soundproofing. It was meticulously clean, and with a charming view toward Mt. Vernon Place in historic Baltimore. The bed was fabulous, and I am fairly particular about beds. All in all, if the surgery of one's spouse can be made less stressful, Home2 managed to do so. I am grateful to the staff and to the management of Home2 Downtown Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and great staff”
Reviews.Author: ahp100
Reviews.Content: This hotel is somewhat spartan, geared for the business traveler. It is clean, well-designed, features a limited by adequate breakfast, and has some kitchen facilities in each room. It is conveniently located near the train station, and quite reasonable. Of special note is the staff who were extraordinarily helpful and knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Really?? No Hot Water??”
Reviews.Author: jfiore3
Reviews.Content: I was here for a one night stay and for the 2 times I wanted to shower, my room did not have hot water. I called the front desk and they said they would send someone right up. After 20 minutes, no one showed up and I needed to get ready to go to work. That was cold shower #1. I spoke with the manager before I left for work and he said they would fix the problem. When I got back, I got an email from the manager assuring me the problem was fixed and it was a larger problem. I walked back into my room and checked to see if I had hot water. Low and behold it was there! Well, when I woke up the next morning, no hot water. Cold and I mean ICE cold!! There was no time to change rooms, call the front desk, or do anything. So, now I was forced to take cold shower #2. Completely unacceptable! Don't bother staying here. Find a nicer place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in Baltimore's Mt Vernon/Arts District”
Reviews.Author: leighbean
Reviews.Content: We spent two nights at the Home2 Suites in November 2011. Hotel was very clean, and the staff were terrific. We booked a queen room with a sofa bed, based on TripAdvisor reviews. The room was big, especially given the price (less than $100/night). Overall, it was a terrific place within walking distance of the Walters Art Museum and the restaurants on Charles Street. (Go to Cazbar.) Overnight garage parking is easy - just a few blocks away if you don't want to deal with the valet service.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing”
Reviews.Author: CRKennedy
Reviews.Content: This hotel was everything my husband and I could have asked for. We wanted to get away and find someplace new, our stay here was excellent. The service was beyond what I was expecting! Lakia, a front desk assistant, was so helpful! The morning of check out I dropped the key to our car in a stream of water and they washed away into a sewer and with her help we were able to get them out! No matter where we go, I'll stay out home2. -Colleen

Reviews.Title: “Great Concept, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: colinaz
Reviews.Content: What a great concept for a hotel. It's basically a small studio apartment, complete with full fridge, microwave and sink. Plates and glasses are provided. So you can, to an extent, cook meals here. Pretty much everything is a 10-minute walk, or less, and the Charm City Circulator (free shuttle bus) stops basically right outside the hotel. I had a car for part of the time I stayed here and parked it overnight on the street. I had no problems and got spots less than a block from the front door. The neighborhood feels pretty safe and there are several restaurants and bars on Charles Avenue, right next to the hotel. The room was excellent. I had a fantastic view of the city (my room faced north), the bed was very comfortable, the wired and wireless internet worked really well and it was very quiet, cozy and comfortable. The hotel staff were nice and helpful, able to give directions and give advice and information on area attractions and restaurants. The casual lobby concept was very cool. There's a front desk area, but the common area is mostly couches and a few high tables, with a TV at the center. This is where breakfast is served. The breakfast was very good, and above the standards of most free hotel breakfasts. They changed the main dish each day but had toast, muffins and oatmeal as staples throughout my stay of three nights. Additionally, just like other Hilton properties with free breakfasts, there's a sort of condiment bar that includes dried fruit, brown sugar and other items, to compliment the oatmeal or cereal. I had a great time in Baltimore and I think at least part of it was because of my decision to stay here. Being able to walk to everything made the logistics a lot more simple and having such a nice room to come back to made it a lot more relaxing. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Family Minication to the Inner Harbor”
Reviews.Author: KandB2008
Reviews.Content: My husband & I took our three children (9,12 & 15) for a weekend get away to Baltimore's Inner Harbor area over President's Day weekend. We had a great experience at the Home2 Suites. We arrived at about 1:30pm and our rooms were ready, so they allowed us to check in early. When I made the reservations online (directly through the hotel's website) I requested to have our two rooms either next to each other or across the hall from each other. They did not have two queen suites together available, so they upgraded us for free to one king suite with an adjoining queen suite. This worked out even better, since we were traveling with the children we put them in one suite, popped open the doors between the adjoining suites and there was plenty of space (and a little privacy) for all of us! The suites themselves were a very nice size with decently sized kitchens including fridge/freezer, microwave, dishwasher, toaster, plates, cups, utensils, etc. Everything was very clean. The hotel as a whole was clean, fresh and modern. Staff was friendly and accommodating. Complimentary continental breakfast in the morning was just enough and there was a decent selection both mornings. The hotel offers a valet parking service of $25 per day. We opted to park the car and either walk everywhere or hop on the city's free bus, the Circulator, which picks up about a block away from the front door. The hotel is about 8 blocks/1 mile from the harbor area and it isn't a bad walk at all. We made the trek up and back several times with the kids in tow at various times of the day & night. Overall, we were very pleased with our stay and will definitely consider staying here again if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: llqool
Reviews.Content: We stayed here over President's Day weekend based on all the good reviews. It lived up to its reputation -- a funky little hotel in a very convenient location. Got a really reasonable AAA rate online. The room was a spacious little suite with a decent size fridge (w/a big freezer), a microwave, and even a dishwasher. There was a sign that we could get an electric hotplate and skillet for free if we wanted one. There were enough dishes etc (and even a bottle opener and measuring cup) for us to have dinner the first night in our room. Decor is very IKEA like, and we could move the ottoman, table and rolling chair around so that we could eat in the room and then play a board game with our kids. We opted to let staff valet park our car (it was supposed to snow, even though it never did) and used the Circulator for our entire stay, since it had a stop right around the corner. Staff was friendly and helpful. Only negatives: 1) there were no luggage carts that first evening when we were trying to check in and transfer our stuff from the car. Ended up making several trips to get luggage up to the room. 2) Walls are paper thin (wasn't a problem for me since I am a fairly heavy sleeper, but my husband said he heard some interesting things! 3) And this is really the one that was the upsetting one - breakfast is included, but it is only served until 9 am, and if you don't get there early, you don't get anything. On our last morning, we got down there at 8:30 and EVERYTHING was gone. No bagels, no bread, no donuts, no english muffins, no eggs, no yogurt. When I inquired about staff replenishing these items, I was told that there were none that were "defrosted," so there was nothing else that was going to be put out. Staff surely know how many guests are staying at the hotel, so they should be able to better judge how much food they need. Overall, it is a nice value hotel with some upscale touches in a really convenient location, and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: shelbyegg
Reviews.Content: I booked a three night stay to visit my sister who is ill and in a nursing home. We have visited Baltimore numerous times over the last year to see here and this was the best hotel stay so far. The room the first night was great. The second night cigarette smoke was discernible and very strong (room 401). We phoned for a new room and were immediately given a new room. The next nights were fine. The workout room was great. It was clean and well lit. The treadmills were nice because of the attached TV feature. The on-street parking from 6 PM to 8 AM was perfect. We were told that by the staff. It saved us valet parking. Especially since we were at the nursing home all day and into the evening. I have to give a shout out to the staff, especially Tyrus MiGlore who checked me in and Linita Foster who made the whole trip better. They made me feel safe and comfortable and welcome. The breakfast was perfect. Great coffee bar and continental breakfast selection. I will go back to visit my sister and will book here again. It was easy access to the highway and to the airport. A great location for business or pleasure. I also liked the curtain between the bed and sitting area. It helped block the light that comes below the door to the room and hall. That annoying light that never goes away? Yeah, that one. That curtain is a sleep saver. At least for me.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a Try....”
Reviews.Author: sccheeto
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just spent three nights at this Hotel. Our purpose for visiting Baltimore was an appointment at Johns Hopkins Hospital. We found the hotel staff to be excellent at this location. Latika saved our butts from having to pay for 2 nights of parking. She is an excellent example of the staff at Home 2 Suites. Nick, the manager, is very hands on and totally credits his staff for their great ratings. We found the location to be perfect for us. Affordable, courteous staff in a great location. Out car wouldn't start when we were ready to leave, and we couldn't have gotten more help from the guys in valet parking..... They deserve a pat on the back for helping us out of a terrible situation. We would stay here again and highly suggest you give this hotel and it's "great" staff a chance. The rooms were nicely furnished and very cozy! The price, compared to the rest of Baltimore, was just right. Thank you all for a great stay! We also love that they are pet friendly, altough we didn't have a pet. This hotel is a little bit Boutique and a little bit Long-term Home. Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “I had a wonderful stay overall.”
Reviews.Author: Sweets410
Reviews.Content: I called the night before my stay and spoke with Unandus he was very helpful with getting me familiar with the area and about parking. With his assistance it made my check-in process a lot easier and the whole weekend went smooth. I met Unandus over the weekend and he was just as polite in person as he was on the phone.

Reviews.Title: “I loved my stay”
Reviews.Author: Eyemurder
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend booked a room at this hotel and Unadus really helped us within the city and recommended a great diner

Reviews.Title: “Home2 Suites by Hilton® Baltimore Downtown”
Reviews.Author: DebrahpSJ
Reviews.Content: Conveniently located in downtown Baltimore, the Home2 Suites by Hilton® Baltimore Downtown is nestled on a small, quiet street close to great local restaurants and bars. Near Mercy Hospital, Baltimore International Airport(BWI) and several major office buildings, Home2 Suites Baltimore Downtown is also close to museums and major attractions such as Inner Harbor, Maryland Science Center and the National Aquarium. Such a great price and includes breakfast. Linita and Lakia

Reviews.Title: “I love a new property with great staff”
Reviews.Author: DCTravelGuru
Reviews.Content: I booked a group block of rooms at this hotel on new years eve. The hotel offered us a great rate, but the place was so fabulous...new, clean, friendly staff, centrally located, wifi and breakfast included...it was worth so much more then we paid for it. I highly recommend this property to anyone looking for a place to stay for business or vacation. The rooms are set up for longer stays so they have kitchens which worked out for me since I had no time to stop for dinner that night before our event. Instead I grabbed a frozen dinner from the lobby (reasonably priced i might add) and popped it in the microwave while I got ready. The room has a lot of little touches, a curtain that you can pull over to seperate the bed area from the couch. So two people could share the room without starring at each other at night. They had pre-printed room lock cards that you could put in the door to notify housekeeping if you brought a pet. The showers have the little footrest for us ladies who need to shave our legs and they had shampoo and bath gel dispensers attached in the shower (much like in a cruise ship cabin). Great spot..I will look for these properties as I travel this year.

Reviews.Title: “the best place for a long stay!”
Reviews.Author: Sebastian L
Reviews.Content: the most "homey" place i've ever stayed. staff was great, rooms were even better. def the best franchise i've ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent concept - Great service”
Reviews.Author: Tkyrnr
Reviews.Content: This hotel has some of the best front desk staff I've come across. Everyone was very friendly and obviously well trained. Rooms layout, size and amenities are very good. We especially liked the curtain that helped give our family of three some privacy. The value proposition is hard to beat for the size of room you get. Finally, they serve very good free coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value - Good Location”
Reviews.Author: BHill75
Reviews.Content: I visited the Home2 Suites hotel November 4 for a one-night stay with my 5 year old child. This brand new hotel was conveniently located to Inner Harbor (which was the purpose of my visit). LOCATION - You can take either the free Baltimore circular (it has a pickup location one block from the hotel) or walk the less than a mile to the Inner Harbor area. The walk was easy and my daughter did it just fine - we felt safe walking (there are a lot of lights and restaurants along the way). We rented a car at the airport and I would recommend parking on the street if you are able to find a space. It is free parking overnight until 8 am the next morning. HOTEL/ROOM - The hotel itself has very bright/bold colors which were a little too mod design for my tastes, but this was not a long-term stay.The rooms look exactly like the pictures. I like the fact that they have a kitchen area. The bed was comfortable, although the layout of the room is a bit oddly designed. The room can easily sleep 4 people using the sleeper coach and it has a divider perfect for a little bit of privacy for parents traveling with kids to separate the sleeping areas. The free breakfast was good and includes the option of hot breakfast sandwiches in addition to the standard cereal, bagel, toast, juice offering. SUMMARY - I would recommend this hotel for price, cleanliness and general value. I would most likely stay there again if I visit in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: JanssenColumbia
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay in November 2011 At Home2 Suites. We liked the design of the suite. It was very nice and clean and everything was new. The staff was very helpful. We would definitley stay there again. We would also look for the chain in other locations.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, nice ammenities in downtown Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Janette B
Reviews.Content: Now that renovations are complete, I highly recommend this hotel for anyone needing a room in downtown Baltimore. Poor reviews were probably submitted prior to or during the remodel. The bed was comfortable and the room was relatively quiet. There were black out shades for the window. There was a nightlight as well as a lamp on the bedside table and the bathroom light switch glowed blue with just enough light for middle of the night visits. There was also an IPOD dock provided, good WIFI access, and a very large HD TV that swiveled. The appliances - microwave, refrigerator and dishwasher - were new. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. Breakfast was basic, cereal, yogurt, assorted breads, coffee, tea, juices and milk. Everyone in my group was satisfied and we certainly could not beat the price. The hotel is within walking distance of the inner harbor and many restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent experience”
Reviews.Author: CWRobinson
Reviews.Content: Staying at the Home2 Suites in Downtown Baltimore was an excellent experience. The hotel is very clean, and the suites are like small apartments with the feeling of being at home. The atmosphere is very casual and friendly. Unita and the other staff members were hospitable and helpful. I would definintely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “NEVER AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: Felicia W
Reviews.Content: First off, the hotel was NOTHING like it advertised. When we finally checked into the hotel, they left our truck sitting outside with the motor running & door open for at least 30mins. Getting upstairs into the room I wanted to take a nice hot relaxing shower, well the shower hose was busted and the water ran out all over the floor. My husband went for housekeeping & came back with an arm full of towels, WTF? Really?? Then we couldn't sleep because when we decided to look out of our bedroom window at the "view" we had a clear view of their "secured parking" where they parked our truck and left the gate wide open, but the absolute worst was we counted at least 50 RATS running around the vehicles and on top of them (as they jumped off the garbage bin), it was truly disgusting & that was MY first trip to MD and Baltimore and it was an experience I NEVER wish to experience EVER again. It actually has me NEVER wanting to pay for ANY other HILTON Hotel experience in any other City, State. I think I will stick with the Hyatt, Hampton Inn, my nxt trip to Baltimore, MD.... Good Luck with this RATty MOtel. I actually received a reimbursement from my travel agent for this booking because I left and found another place to stay on my visit.....

Reviews.Title: “Almost Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Keith S
Reviews.Content: I loved the location, the staff were excellent and the rooms were great. Only problem was that when we checked in the shower was DIRTY. And when I say dirty I mean there was an open, used bar of soap on the rack and some disgusting brown stains near the drain. On the plus side when we called downstairs someone came right up and took care of the problem. Definitely creeped me out a bit though...

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff and excellent value”
Reviews.Author: txnewlyweds411
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a work trip. The room was perfect. It was spacious, clean, quiet (except for trash in the middle of the night). Workout room had enough equipment to get a decent workout. Free breakfast has a variety of options to suit everyone's needs. The room includes everything you would need for a longer stay. We were only here for two nights, but if you needed a place to stay for a week or longer, this would be a gem. I was suprised how nice the hotel was for the price and location. Good bars and restaurants are within easy walking distance. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Little Hotel in a Good Location”
Reviews.Author: HerrOber
Reviews.Content: I was very delighted to stumble across this place, and I would be happy to stay their again. I loved the layout of the rooms, the entire staff treated me great... It was all good.

Reviews.Title: “Hipster, clean, green, awesome”
Reviews.Author: lindseysnyder
Reviews.Content: 1. I have stayed in every metro Baltimore hilton and this new brand is my FAV. 2. Location: monument area..not as thouristy, great food within walking distance. Grocery right across the street. SUPER easy to access johns Hopkins. Baltimore can be confusing to drive around but this location is perfect for getting to Hopkins. 3. Hotel appearance: clean modern and green. I love the sheets! And want to get a set for home. There are outlets by the bed!!!!!! And the ihome alarm is a really touch. 4. Hotel staff: unha has checked me in several times and couldn't be nicer. I messed up my confirmation this last time and she was speedy in finding me a room. 5. Jhu has a special rate so call for details.

Reviews.Title: “Lost in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on a small, quiet side street very close to the Inner Harbor. My GPS had me drive around the block numerous times, and I kept missing the street. After I quit listening to the Tom Tom, I ended up SO lost that I had to call the hotel. I spoke with a woman named Lakia, and she became my hero! She actually navigated me through the rainy streets of Baltimore in rush hour traffic.At one point she had to let me go, in order to help a guest. Unexpectedly, she called me back just to make sure I was still alright. This hotel is very clean, well appointed and has a STELLAR staff. Thanks to Lakia, I will be a guest at the Home 2 everytime I stay in Baltimore. Thank you Lakia, and Home 2!

Reviews.Title: “Hilton Finally Hits a Homerun!”
Reviews.Author: admit_it
Reviews.Content: I have been growing very tired of Hilton's less than imaginative room decor in all of their new hotels. While they are nice, they are very corporate. With the likes of Aloft by W Hotels, along with Element - Hilton had been ignoring market trends and pricing. I stayed at this property for an work event at the convention center. The walk to the Harbor and Convention Center area is about 1/2 mile downhill (on the way there....) and very do-able in the morning, however, when the sun goes down the sense of safety and security disappear with the daylight. I've been traveling to Charm City for work for five year now, and as the recession has been prolonged, the crime in the city has sky rocketed. However.... the neighborhood around the hotel is very safe, and I wasn't afraid at all to walk in the neighborhood at night. The hotel is fantastic - the concept is totally different than anything else that Hilton is doing. The property has a very small and comfortable feeling - while having hundreds of rooms, there only 9-10 rooms on each floor - so it feels very small. The breakfast service is a game changer as well - it's a departure from a buffet style, and yet there is still something for everyone. The rooms are very well appointed, spacious, and geared toward the extended stay traveler - they are well suited for a night or a month. It's great having the kitchenette in the room. The decor is very trendy and comfortable! If you are planning a stay in downtown Baltimore, I definitely suggest the Home 2! Great stay, friendly staff, and fantastic rooms! I had a AAA rate of $103 - and instead of paying $25 a night for Valet parking, I parked a couple blocks away in the garage next to the Basilica - and that was only $24 for two nights. I parked in front of the hotel, took my luggage to my room, and then moved my car to the garage. The garage is very safe, well lit, and easy to access. I'm not a fan of Valet parking - I want my car when I want it, not when the valets have time to get it. As with nearly all hotels that have a food shop available in the lobby - everything is very over priced, so avoid it if at all possible. The only negative was the ice machine on my floor wasn't working. So, Hilton, you finally caught up with the trends, now let's continue to repeat the success!

Reviews.Title: “Natural Products Expo”
Reviews.Author: Timothy K
Reviews.Content: Staff at the hotel were friendly, and they provided us with all the amenities needed. Lakia, Joyce, Tyrus, Linita, and Nataisha were so warm that it made me feel like I had people there who really cared about me as a customer. The breakfast provided was a little above standard, and the decorations in the common areas were cozy and also a little coffee shop like. During one night, we had the unfortunate incident of leaking coming from the floor above our bathroom. We called up the front desk and they were able to find us another room to use in a different floor. It was a little inconvenient moving all of our stuff in the middle of the night, but the fact that they were able to find us a replacement room was reasonable. Fitness room was reasonable, and the laundry was convenient. The only thing I would ask for is a nice cool natural, organic, dark lager, and pool and/or jacuzzi in the room to sip it in!

Reviews.Title: “Danbury Club”
Reviews.Author: Maryjaneb33753
Reviews.Content: I found the hotel to be very very clean--the personnel were terrific-Nick,Tyrus,Lorraine and all of the crew--can't remember all their names--sorry--the location is perfect for anywhere you want to go in Baltimore -- we already booked for May 2012 for our group of 9 to 10 couples--can't say enough about it--AND the price is right-

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: buffee19
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Home2 Suites in Baltimore while visting friends. I can't say enough good things about this hotel! The staff were all super friendly and very accomodating! The room was as pictured and was not only spacious but also very clean! The bed was one of the most comfortable hotel beds I have even slept in! I will definitely book this hotel for my next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in a Convenient Location”
Reviews.Author: ThomasMWH
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Home2 on two separate occasions; once for a two-week period during the Grand Prix and another during the marathon, and both times were fantastic. It is located off the beaten path far enough away from the Inner Harbor craziness, yet one can simply walk approximately one mile to all of the "action". It's on a couple of MTA bus routes as well as the Charm City Circulator (the free bus owned by the city) which is good because those routes travel to Federal Hill and Fells Point, among other areas. The room costs are very reasonable, the gym is small but more than adequate for a quick workout, and they even have laundry facilities for those longer stays. Most importantly, the front desk staff is extremely nice and accommodating. I'd single out an individual but everyone I have dealt with great! I plan on staying at the Home2 for all my business and personal travel to the Baltimore area.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome rooms, location, and staff”
Reviews.Author: Ziyad L
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks during the grand prix and by the time I left I was friends with everyone on staff. They are a great crew and now my company only books this hotel when we are in Baltimore. Thank you Linita for all of you help!

Reviews.Title: “Euro Hotel Atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: rca2
Reviews.Content: A hip change for the savvy traveler, the Home2 Suites in Baltimore just opened in June 2011 and was interesting. The lobby is spartan and modest being little more than an entrance off of a side street. Modern decor seemed aimed at a younger crowd but we enjoyed everything about this trendy hotel. Rooms are very spacious for the hotel class and priced very reasonably being very well appointed as studio types with kitchen, bath, living area and king bed. Breakfast is included with basic fare for this price point. We'll do it again!

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME!!”
Reviews.Author: kimimc713
Reviews.Content: My family & I stayed here over Columbus Day weekend (10/6-10/8) We were a little nervous when we pulled up on this teeny, tiny street.....my son was afraid we were "staying at the 3 little pigs house!" Natasha- was at the desk when we check in- she is the perfect 1st impression! EVERY staff member was one more helpful & friendly than the next! The room was CLEAN, CLEAN & have plenty of room for my family of 5. The opening special was a great price. Every aspect of this hotel was AWESOME: staff, cleaniless, space,sheets, bed, furniture, shower, kitchen, breakfast area, wifi..... incredible! I hope more Home2Suites pop up around the country!

Reviews.Title: “New Eco-Friendly Rooms”
Reviews.Author: gilber20
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 1 night with two boys (6 yrs, 4 yrs) and enjoyed the eco-friendly rooms that were newly renovated. WiFi signal was very strong and access is included with the room. We liked the 12th floor room (high floor), but experienced some noise from a party on the 14th floor late on Saturday night. Location is not ideal for sightseeing by the Inner Harbor. We had to take taxis back and forth, but did not have time to use the Charm City Circulator bus. On Sunday morning, the free breakfast was nice for the kids. However, I think the weekend hours should change to 7am-10am instead of 6am-9am. Valet parking was convenient. I was a little concerned about safety at night and street parking.

Reviews.Title: “Very good, not outstanding”
Reviews.Author: brancepethdli
Reviews.Content: Lots of positive aspects, excellent comfortable bed and pillows, good amount of space for a downtown hotel room, kitchen space good, shower great, free fast wifi, little noise from outside, very close to the free circulator bus. Excellent price for a downtown hotel because of opening deals but the standard price advertised might make me choose elsewhere. What could be better? Breakfasts are chaotic when it is busy because of the trendy but inefficient room layout, lack of fruit at breakfast, managers are very good at their approach to customers but other staff need to follow their example.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh furnishings, great space, excellent value”
Reviews.Author: jl2117
Reviews.Content: Stayed 3 nights here and was really pleased. The room had lots of space, the bed was firm and comfortable, fast wi-fi and the staffers were very friendly and helpful each time I needed them. Compared pretty favorably to Residence Inn or Embassy Suites. The location was conveniently on the free Charm City Circulator bus route which saved me cab fare at least a half dozen times. My only recommended upgrade would be the breakfast options. Granted it was free but I couldn't find any fruit and the only hot option was some sort of packaged eggy sandwich that you ran through a Quiznos-type broiler contraption that took more than a couple minutes to heat up the sandwich. The run-of-the-mill waffle machine might be old hat but I would venture most people would rather see one out there than the current set-up. Just a suggestion, not a complaint. I had an excellent stay.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: Washington, District of Columbia, United States
Reviews.Title: “A great find!”
Reviews.Author: Marisa P
Reviews.Content: I arrived for a conference, staying at Home2Suites since the conference hotel was sold out. I didn't really know what to expect. The website looked enticing and I was very pleased to discover the thoughtful design, layout and customer experience that Home2Suites provided. The rooms are large, well-designed and clean. It's like living in an Ikea showroom. For 3 days or a month, Home2Suites is the perfect fit. With complimentary breakfasts and well stocked mini market, a gym and laundry services (they're also pet friendly), it's very refreshing to find a hotel that really caters to the customer without making them pay considerably for it. Thanks, Hilton -- you seem to have created a boutique hotel that is also functional.

Reviews.Title: “Hilton goes boutique”
Reviews.Author: CookswithpassionVA
Reviews.Content: I stayed only one night to attend an Orioles game and was surprised to see that the hotel was just tucked away on a side street. I arrived in Baltimore via Amtrak from DC and took a cab, which took 15 minutes and was about $8 including tip. I realized afterward that I could have taken the free Circulator bus from Penn Station and it would have dropped me about a block away. I walked up the short hill the next morning to get the Circulator back to the station--it took about seven minutes. These buses run about every 15 minutes. It was a 20-minute walk downhill to Camden Yards, and it would be a similar walking time to the Inner Harbor. I could have taken the Circulator, which has a stop about three blocks from the stadium, but the weather was lovely and exercise is always good! It was impossible to get a cab after the game, and while I was a bit hesitant to walk back to the hotel at 10:30p, it was fine. The hotel is quite refreshing and boutique-y. It's a nice departure from the Embassy, Doubletree or Homewood Suites, which are also in the Hilton portfolio. As other reviewers have said, the rooms are spacious, comfortable, and well-equipped, and the breakfast was adequate. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Real home away from home”
Reviews.Author: ConsultantKate
Reviews.Content: This newly-reno'd place has it all -- spacious, full equipped studio suites, super-friendly and helpful staff, a gym, free laundry, wireless that really works and a great location! After trying several mediocre (and one downright awful) hotels in BWI, I have found my home-away-from-home -- this is my ONLY place to stay in Baltimore!

Reviews.Title: “really nice stay”
Reviews.Author: LisaBostonMA
Reviews.Content: The room had a great view, was clean, (I found out when I got there it was in fact, new), and had a well stocked kitchenette. The breakfast was simple, but good and the breakfast room was a good place to hang out if you needed to wait for somebody. The service was perfect, with maid service responding very rapidly to each request I made. Although this place is advertized for business travellers, it turned out to be a great place for my husband, I and my toddler to stay, given that there was a good size fridge and a microwave for keeping & heating snacks/leftovers/milk They also had a travel-size crib and were very accomodating of scheduling room cleaning around nap time.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasantly Suprised.........”
Reviews.Author: dbbohner
Reviews.Content: I was hesitant to stay here because I am so spoiled I try to stay at the number one or two hotels whenever I travel. I couldn't find a lot of information on this hotel and knew it was pretty new and that it cost me very little points to stay there for a few days so I took the chance. We had been traveling for much of the day hitting every kind of traffic. This trip was to drop my daughter at school and being miles and miles from home I arrived in Baltimore very sad. The hotel is on a narrow street that is not well lit. This worried me right away. I also noticed that the parking was limited to the sides of the street or valet parking was available at $25 per day. We entered the building and from the entrance to the desk we were greeted with smiling happy faces wishing us good will etc. Forgive me but I forget the woman helping us that first night. That would be Wednesday, 8/24/11. I think her name might have been Joyce. She was the sweetest, most helpful, friendly, talkative person. She was the reason I started to relax. The rooms are all suites. They are newer with newer fixtures, dishes and all. Very nice value. The bed was comfortable but the first night we didn't have all of the sheets for the fold out bed. My daughter didn't care and was so tired she slept before we could call anyone. The only other not nice thing was how my husband had to run around for ice. He went to all applicable floors and was finally helped by the desk on the first floor. We were on the 8th or 10th. I can't exactly remember. The valet was so helpful on our day out he guided us to the highway. He was another helpful, nice person. I would recommend this hotel to any traveler but especially to those needing to stay for a while due to work.

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleased overall”
Reviews.Author: Ben S
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the hotel 8/5 - 8/7. I had 4 rooms with my family. I'm a long time Hilton Diamond member and couldn't pass on the 7,500 pts per night for the room. Obviously as a Diamond member I've stayed numerous times at Hilton. I was very impressed with the size of the rooms, the kitchenette and FREE LAUNDRY.lol The front desk staff was AWESOME. The elevators were small, but I understand why. The breakfast may need some tweaks. Parking or lack of it may be a concern for some, but we found plenty of free parking on the street.The proximity to Inner Harbor was great. the free Charm Circulator was an added bonus. we're definitely coming back!! Did i mention the front desk staff was AWESOME!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very clean and nice.”
Reviews.Author: MargaretVirginia_USA
Reviews.Content: This hotel has been completely renovated since its last life with another chain. Everything is fresh and new--it has complete kitchenettes and large modern bathrooms, and is well suited to its stated purpose of extended stays.. I'm not a big fan of lime green but since that's the "new" color, the hotel certainly appears very hip and up-to-date. The lobby is small and sparsely furnished but adequate for the purpose. The folks at the front desk were friendly. The complimentary continental breakfast is a little skimpy but serves the purpose. The hotel's location off Charles Street close to the Mount Vernon district makes it a little far to walk to the harbor area. There is limited street parking and valet parking is quite expensive. We got a great deal on an introductory rate to this hotel so it was a great bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, a new favorite”
Reviews.Author: Scott S
Reviews.Content: We came through Baltimore for a ball game and decided to stay another day to see the aquarium and inner harbor. This hotel was recommended by a friend and we could not be happier with the stay. The hotel was great, clean throughout, and spacious rooms with so many wonderful amenities. And extra props to the staff...they were all very friendly and helpful! This place is my top choice for any stay in the downtown Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “Great location in the Heart of Mt. Vernon”
Reviews.Author: Kerrianne S
Reviews.Content: The entire staff was friendly, helpful and courteous. They provided quality service and treated me like family. My room was fantastic! It was on the 12th floor and had a great view of Mt. Vernon Park. It was quiet at all times and at night was comfortable to sleep in the air conditioning and pitch dark (thanks to room darkening shades). Loved the full kitchen and sleeper sofa. The complimentary laundry was a nice touch for a long term stay like mine (of 6 weeks). And, Charles Street has fabulous restaurants...within walking distance. The amenities I missed most were...a bath tub, an oven/stove top, a balcony or immediate outdoor access, and a pool. I would recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a suite hotel in Inner Harbor. Thank you, Kerrianne

Reviews.Title: “Trying so hard, but striking out"”
Reviews.Author: ARS5285
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for a family wedding in Baltimore, we knew that this was a new hotel when we booked, but the phenomenal deals that Hilton was offering its Honors members to stay were too good to pass up. I can't speak to the value of the hotel because we got such a great deal using points. We booked our room, and then subsequent family members booked an additional block of rooms, I think it was 9 all told, this review will cover both our experience, and a bit of information from the others staying in our group. The hotel has been open about six weeks, and we were visiting at the height of tourist season, on an Orioles two game weekend, so we were expecting crowds, but we were also expecting a hotel that was a bit more equipped to deal with them. The hotel is tucked on a small one way side street, with only an awning to distinguish it from other buildings, the only parking options currently are valet or self-park (ie find a garage yourself and risk it), and there is no dedicated valet, it is apparently a corollary duty of the desk staff, there is no place to pull up and unload baggage except for the one parking space in front of the hotel, so if someone is there before you, you get to block traffic or try to find an on-street spot from which to unload your bags, the staff was not particularly well trained to deal with this, as we were told that we couldn't park in a "pay spot" despite a valet vehicle sitting in the only spot the entire 20 minutes we were checking in. Due to the size of the elevators and the aesthetics of the hotel the only baggage carts available are the SmartCart style that you see for rent at airports, they are good for loading about one large piece of luggage and a carry-on. This seemed highly impractical for what is described as an extended stay hotel, we were finishing out a 10 day trip, with several formal events and even as light packers it took us 2 trips to bring our things up to the room (all the while blocking the 1 parking spot), there are no offers of bell service either. We just beat the rush of people checking in, so while we didn't have much of a wait, others behind us did, it took the desk agent about 5 minutes of logging in to finally get to the screen where she could process our information. We requested a high floor King bed room, away from the elevators. We got room 1101 out of I think 14 floors, and all of the rooms are near the elevators as it is a narrow site and each floor only has 4-5 rooms. The door was heavy enough to block out all but the loudest hallway and elevator noise. Our room had lots of counter space, with a desk/dresser area and a sizable kitchen area running the length of the room, the work space would be ample to put in a full day's work from the room, and the clothing storage space was generous. The dresser/work area did lack a mirror, which would have allowed it to double as a vanity area for those who don't like to do their hair or makeup in a steamy bathroom, instead I ended up perched on an ottoman in front of a poorly lit full length mirror in the living area of the room. The room had a queen sized pull out sofa and a movable ottoman. The ottoman was tucked under the TV when we entered the room, it was the perfect spot for a luggage rack, which was also apparently eliminated from the room for not matching the aesthetics (none were available at the front desk either). The room was very soothing with grays and greens, it was nicely decorated, but not wholly practical for anyone but a single traveler. The biggest issue we had with the layout was the impracticality of the "barn door" type bathroom door, it seems to be a bit of a trend in boutique hotels of late, to mount a pocket door outside of the wall to function as a bathroom door, some places do this well and the room benefits from the space saving design elements, but this was not one of those places. It seems that there was a design/installation mis-calculation, and the depth of the wall tile was not calculated into the clearance for the "barn door" to close flush with the wall, as a result, the door was off of it's bottom track, leaving about a two inch gap between the wall and the door, and allowing the door to glide open far too easily. This meant no privacy for the person using the bathroom, this flaw was universally commented on by our group (granted, they are a home building sort of group). The bathroom was a decent size, with a stall shower, and wall mounted Neutrogena Rainbath and Shampoo dispensers (one of ours was empty the entire stay). 3 towel hooks were provided and the sink top space was not extravagant but was ample for two of us. The toilet is a water saving dual flush model, unfortunately ours was not very water saving as it ran for about an hour after every fourth flush or so, seems like something that shouldn't happen in a brand new hotel. The bathroom is very white tile, so any housekeeping oversights are quite obvious. Otherwise, we found the roller sheers and roller blackout shade in the room to work nicely as a window covering, it didn't leave the typical hotel room curtain gap, and provided enough room darkening to sleep in on the bright morning after the wedding (we had to provide 2 wake-up calls to my hung-over parents). The other compliment for the room is that it had some of the softest sheets we have yet encountered in a Hilton hotel. Other hiccups encountered: One of the main reasons the rest of our family elected to stay at this hotel over others was because they told us that their shuttle service would be up and running by the time our group was staying (this was about 6 weeks earlier) and that they could make a shuttle available to take us to the wedding at the Inner Harbor. Upon check-in I was informed that their shuttle van was still broken, and would not be available at all for the weekend. There was quite a bit of confusion about the availability of other shuttles, and one staff person began looking for other options, which was a laudable effort, but which instead of being free, would end up being far more costly than even taking cabs. While she was doing this another staff person was calling different rooms in our group trying to figure out when we needed cars (despite me calling her directly with my room number, and introducing myself and requesting that cabs be called half an hour before our departure) for Friday evening, the end result of the many calls was that when everyone gathered in the lobby the cabs that I had requested she call had not been called at all, so a mad scramble for cabs ensued. Car confusion continued throughout the weekend, despite the best efforts of the staff to provide cab access as readily as possible (including running uphill to a main street in 100 degree weather to hail a cab for my sister and I who were running late for the wedding and in formal wear). The efforts of the staff were very much appreciated, although they were far more effort than just having the functioning shuttle service that was originally offered as a service. Breakfast also ended quite early relative to most Hiltons, it was over at 9 am on the weekend, and the coffee carafes in the lobby were empty as often as not, the breakfast was a fancied up low end hotel breakfast, not as many options as the Hampton, but some fresh options that pleased our light eaters. The last thing, and I am not sure that there was anything that the staff could have done about it, other than deal with it cheerfully, but upon returning from the wedding around 1 am we stepped into an elevator and found that someone had urinated all over the floor. Charming. We called the front desk when we got to our room and the desk staff actually responded with "Fabulous, we will take care of that right away" without an ounce of sarcasm, which I give them great credit for! Other observations from family members: Those on the lower floors found their rooms to be quite loud, and a number of them up to the 4th floor had trouble sleeping due to urban noise. I believe they were in even numbered rooms, we were in an odd numbered room on the back side of the hotel and had no noise issues. My parents also mentioned that they found the noise between rooms to be troublesome with rude neighbors next door, they had a toddler throwing a tantrum and screaming at the top of her lungs for about an hour on Saturday morning, and they could quite clearly hear her and her mother yelling at her. Another relative was pleased with the proximity to the new free Charm City Circulator bus. Others said it took them quite some time to check out around 10 am, I can't vouch for what it looked like at check out time on Sunday. All in all, it was a decent hotel for the space, it was an ok location, their staff seems to be earnest, but it does seem that perhaps they are not getting all of the tools and training they need to make this hotel a success. As a traveler who has lived in hotels for 4 months out of the last 2 years, I would say that the amenities offered outside of this hotel room would make an extended stay a challenge, if you were planning to stay for a long time you would want to prepare most of your meals in your room yourself, which would mean microwavable food for the duration. It is a stylish looking hotel, and hopefully they will iron out the wrinkles, and price the hotel at a price point where people aren't using the elevators as a bathroom, but perhaps not at the same expensive price point of other chain hotels in Baltimore.

Reviews.Title: “New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: wsesmom
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful new hotel. The rooms are very spacious and have full size kitchenettes. Room darkening blinds that make you think it is actually dark outside, and Smoking rooms available for the smokers. It doesnt set right in the area of all the busy hustle and bustle but is within walking distance of the inner harbor. We stayed in a different state and area every nite for a week and paid well over 250.00 for the rooms, this room was the cheapest and the best of all of them. Would gladly stay again. Staff is very friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelinglady62
Reviews.Content: This was our second trip to Baltimore, and our first stay at a Home 2 Suites. This was one of the best hotels I've stayed at! Everyone who works there, from the manager to the housekeeping staff, were polite, friendly, and very helpful. The rooms are a good size, the kitchenette was a great size! We had no problems with anything being dirty or not clean. Our dishes, cups, bowls, and silverware were very clean! The work space was big, and the WiFi worked wonderful! The bathroom was a good size. We had a walk in shower, no tub. The hotel is about 2 blocks from the free city bus that runs down to the Inner Harbor. We had no problems during our stay. Our room was cleaned daily, the housekeeping staff was wonderful! They do have laundry facalities in the hotel. The best part is they are free! Breakfast was great! I did notice towels in the excerise room, unlike one post I read. The Wii room was always clean, the excerise room was clean, and the laundry area was also very clean! I will definitly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great new find in Baltimore”
Reviews.Author: expresser
Reviews.Content: I travel to Baltimore a lot for business and rarely leave reviews as i get used to the same old rooms and stays...Ill admit I am either gonna review you with an excellent if you wow me or you have to be pretty terrible to get me to review you badly and/or come back... I heard Hilton came out with a new brand that was geared towards the "tech savvy" traveler...which I may or may not be, but for the price this was at in downtown near inner harbor, I figured I would check it out.....so glad I did. Hotel is full of bright open lobby space and a very simple room that has everything i needed to work and enjoy my stay. A wall mounted pull out large LCD tv that swivled to my desk or bed was great so I did not ever have to mvoe furniture or be uncomforable in bed on the laptop just to also watch tv was great. Wifi was fast which was most important to me (was able to use my ipad, droid and laptop with no slowness at once) Breakfast was surprisingly good (sorry to say surprisingly but so used to the cookie cutter ones)...it had a yogurt bar with lots of toppings which was excellent and every seat in the breakfast area had plugs for my laptop.... I try to run at least one morning of my travels and the fitness center here was great....every piece of equipment had its own TV and the area was spacious...like it was actaully built to have a fitness room....(sorry, but too many hotels fitness rooms are an afterthought with crappy equipment...and this was an obvious exception!!!) anyway, I'll be back....kudos on a well thought out hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great property, would not stay anywhere else in Baltimore!”
Reviews.Author: grizmt
Reviews.Content: What can I say that's not a commercial except for kudos to the front desk staff! Probably some of the most friendly helpful desk people I've run across in a long, long time. Comfortable rooms designed for a long stay but worked well for the 3 days we were here. Free laundry in basement with 3 sets of front loaders as well as game room with a new WI and gym room. Did I mention FREE LAUNDRY? I've been a HH member for over 10 years and am very pleased with this new Hilton concept.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the brand new hotel suites!”
Reviews.Author: lovingalice
Reviews.Content: This was our first time visiting Baltimore area and the Home2 Suites really made our trip a blast! Our room was pretty spacious with study area/relaxing area/room area. So when my husband was checking his emails (free wifi!), I could totally enjoy my movies like I was in a different room. I especially like the modern colorful design. The hotel is just very new! Complimentary breakfast was a plus, although I usually don't eat much. Overall the staff was very helpful and was able to provide us all local info we need (what to see, where to eat...etc). I am glad we stayed at this hotel cause this is so close to everything I want to see. The downtown location is so convenient and it is close to inner harbor area,too. We found a pretty good deal on the hotel website. I will definitely come back next time I visit Baltimore! :)

HotelInfo.Name: Home2 Suites by Hilton Baltimore Downtown
HotelInfo.Address: 8 East Pleasant Street, Baltimore, MD 21202 (Formerly Comfort Inn & Suites Baltimore)
